name: Missir Wot Pizza - Ethiopian Red lentil stew, Kale on Gluten free Teff Pizza Crust. vegan recipe
description: Missir Wot Pizza - Ethiopian Red lentil stew, Kale on Gluten free Teff Pizza Crust. vegan recipe
recipeIngredient: a generous pinch of cumin powder (optional)
1/2 cup whole lentils (sabut Masoor, brown lentils soaked for atleast 2 hours to overnight)
Chopped cilantro or fresh herbs of choice

recipeInstructions.text: Miss wot: Whole Red lentil Stew:
recipeInstructions.name: Miss wot: Whole Red lentil Stew:

recipeInstructions.text: In a pressure cooker or pan, add oil and heat over low-medium.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pressure cooker or pan, add oil and heat over low-medium.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the onion and garlic and cook until translucent. 10-12 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the onion and garlic and cook until translucent. 10-12 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the berbere spice and mix. cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the berbere spice and mix. cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the soaked lentils, salt and water. Mix well and cook over medium for 2 whistles in whistling pressure cooker then on low for 15 minutes. ( 10 minutes after the pressure has reached for electric pressure cooker)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the soaked lentils, salt and water. Mix well and cook over medium for 2 whistles in whistling pressure cooker then on low for 15 minutes. ( 10 minutes after the pressure has reached for electric pressure cooker)

recipeInstructions.text: If using pan, Add them to the onion mixture along with salt, water and cook on medium, partially covered until the lentils start to disintegrate. 40-45 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: If using pan, Add them to the onion mixture along with salt, water and cook on medium, partially covered until the lentils start to disintegrate. 40-45 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust salt and spice, take off heat and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and adjust salt and spice, take off heat and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: You can also use pink/red lentils for a quicker cooking time
recipeInstructions.name: You can also use pink/red lentils for a quicker cooking time

recipeInstructions.text: Crust:
recipeInstructions.name: Crust:

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, add warm water, yeast and sugar, Mix well and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, add warm water, yeast and sugar, Mix well and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl. mix all the flours, starches, salt, baking powder and spice/cumin if using.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl. mix all the flours, starches, salt, baking powder and spice/cumin if using.

recipeInstructions.text: Add dry flours to yeast mixture. Add evoo and vinegar and whisk into a smooth batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add dry flours to yeast mixture. Add evoo and vinegar and whisk into a smooth batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the batter sit for 1.5 hours. The batter with rise and become spongy.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the batter sit for 1.5 hours. The batter with rise and become spongy.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix it and drop onto parchment lined sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix it and drop onto parchment lined sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle a teaspoon of evoo and 'lightly' pat down the batter into desired shape using your hands. Spray water liberally on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Drizzle a teaspoon of evoo and 'lightly' pat down the batter into desired shape using your hands. Spray water liberally on top.

recipeInstructions.text: (you can also make the crust in an 8 inch cake pan to make a slightly fatter and even more softer crust like this gf Oat focaccia crust.
recipeInstructions.name: (you can also make the crust in an 8 inch cake pan to make a slightly fatter and even more softer crust like this gf Oat focaccia crust.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F / 190ºc. and let the crust sit near the oven or in a warm place for 10 to 15 minutes. you should see that the crust rises a bit.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F / 190ºc. and let the crust sit near the oven or in a warm place for 10 to 15 minutes. you should see that the crust rises a bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in preheated 375 degrees F / 190ºc for 10 minutes. Place a foil on the baking sheet without touching the top of the batter if possible, during baking.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in preheated 375 degrees F / 190ºc for 10 minutes. Place a foil on the baking sheet without touching the top of the batter if possible, during baking.

recipeInstructions.text: Take crust out and load with chopped kale and then Missir wot lentils and cheese of choice. I used Daiya Cheddar.
recipeInstructions.name: Take crust out and load with chopped kale and then Missir wot lentils and cheese of choice. I used Daiya Cheddar.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray water on the edges and bake for another 8-10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray water on the edges and bake for another 8-10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Take pizza out, top with fresh herbs. Let sit for a minute before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Take pizza out, top with fresh herbs. Let sit for a minute before slicing.

recipeInstructions.text: Best served hot.
recipeInstructions.name: Best served hot.
